results.title: Microsoft Excel 4.0 for Windows: intermediate and advanced skills
results.brief_description: Narrated by Sheila Swanson, this is a step-by-step guide showing how to perform advanced functions in Excel 4.0 for Windows. Skills learned include: how to create charts using Chartwizard, enhancing charts, giving your spreadsheet that professional touch, formatting using chart windows, customising the toolbar, creating and running macros, linking single cells, linking a range of cells and creating dynamic data links.

results.title: Microsoft encarta 1994 (MAC)
results.brief_description: An interactive learning resource with text of Funk & Wagnalls New Encylopedia, sound, image, animation, video clips, maps, interactive charts Timeline, atlas and knowledge adventure game. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Colour Mac II or higher, Colour Classic or Powerbook; System 7 or later; 4 Mb of memory; at least 3 Mb of available hard disk space; CD_ROM drive.

results.title: Microsoft encarta '95 (PC)
results.brief_description: An interactive learning resource with text of the Funk & Wagnalls New Encyclopedia, sound, images, animation, video clips, maps, interactive charts, timeline, atlas and knowledge adventure game, also includes interactive tour of Encarta called Mind-maze. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC or PC compatible with 386SX or higher processor; audio board; SVGA resolution monitor with 256 colours or higher; 4Mb of RAM; at least 3.5Mb of available disk space; Microsoft Windows 3.1; MS-DOS 3.1 or later.

results.title: Microsoft dinosaurs (PC)
results.brief_description: Grab your jungle gear, put on your pith helmet and brace yourself - you’re going on a journey of a lifetime! Travel deep into the forest primeval and come face to face with those incredible animals that roamed and ruled the Earth millions of years ago. Hear them growl, explore their habitats and see who they meet in mortal combat.

Hear them growl, explore their habitats and see who they meet in mortal combat. results.title: Microsoft dangerous creatures (MAC)
results.brief_description: Hear a twig snap underfoot. See a flash of fur race through the trees. Was that the hunter or the hunted? Get close to more than 250 of the wildest creatures on Earth through 800 detailed articles, hundreds of full-colour photographs, and hours of sound and narration - all reviewed by the World Wildlife Fund. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: any Macintosh computer that supports a 256-colour or higher resolution monitor; System 6.0.7 or later; 4 Mb of memory; at least 1 Mb avaiable hard disk space; CD-ROM drive.

results.title: Microsoft complete NBA basketball. '94-95 ed.(PC)
results.brief_description: Basketball’s most spectacular plays come to life in exciting video and audio clips.. This CD ROM offers a courtside seat for all the excitement, facts and figures of one of the world’s most poular sports. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC with a 386SX or higher processor, 4Mb of memory, at least 3Mb of hard-disk space, CD ROM drive, audio board and super VGA monitor. MS-DOS operating system and Microsoft Windows, version 3.1 or later.

results.title: Microsoft complete baseball. - 1995 edition. (PC)
results.brief_description: Complete baseball gives you comprehensive details on all the past and current Major League players and teams - the records and history of 150 years of exciting baseball action. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC with a 386SX or higher processor, 4Mb of memory, at least 3Mb of available hard disk space, CD ROM drive,audio board, super VGA monitor, MS-DOS and Windows 3.1 or later, Mouse and speakers.

results.title: Microsoft cinemania '95 (PC)
results.brief_description: An excellent reference multi-media programme for cinema research purposes. It features film-clips, dialogue and stills from over one hundred films as well as a comprehensive listing of international cinema that can be accessed by title, director or actor. Film sources are from Pauline Kaels’ “5000 Nights at the Movies” and from the books of Roger Ebert and Ephraim Katz. SYSTEM REQUIRMENTS: Multimedia PC or compatible with a 386SX or higher microprocessor; 2 Mb of RAM, 5 Mb of available hard-disk space; VGA or higher resolution monitor; MS DOS operating system version 3.1 or higher; Microsoft Windows operating system version 3.1 or later.

results.title: Microsoft cinemania '95 (MAC)
results.brief_description: An excellent reference multi-media programme for cinema research purposes. It features film-clips, dialogue and stills from over one hundred films as well as a comprehensive listing of international cinema that can be accessed by title; director; or actor. Film sources are from Pauline Kaels’ “5000 Nights at the Movies” and from the books of Roger Ebert and Ephraim Katz. SYSTEM REQUIRMENTS: Any Macintosh computer that supports a 256-colour, 13” (640x 480) of higher resolution monitor. System 7 or later. 4 Mb of memory, however 5-8Mb strongly recommended and 4Mb of available hard disk space.
